passage:
(1) Our world is made up of large pieces of land called continents and large bodies of water called oceans. There are seven continents: Asia, Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe, and Australia. Asia is the largest continent, while Australia is the smallest.

(2) The four main oceans are the Pacific Ocean, the Atlantic Ocean, the Indian Ocean, and the Arctic Ocean. The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest ocean. It covers about one-third of the Earth's surface. The Atlantic Ocean is the second largest ocean and separates Europe and Africa from North and South America.

(3) Each continent has different countries, languages, and cultures. For example, Asia has 48 countries including China, India, and Japan. Africa has 54 countries and is known for its wildlife and deserts. Europe is home to countries like France, Germany, and Italy. The Americas have countries such as the United States, Canada, Brazil, and Mexico.

(4) Oceans are important for many reasons. They provide food and help control the weather and climate. Ships use oceans to transport goods between continents. Oceans are also home to thousands of different plants and animals. Many people enjoy swimming, sailing, and fishing in oceans. It is important to keep oceans clean and protect the life in them.
